intro: Rhabdotheca squarrosa, commonly known as the squarrose rhabdotheca, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, white pubescence. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically in dense inflorescences, and are usually pale green to yellowish in color. Rhabdotheca squarrosa is adapted to drought conditions, making it a hardy plant in dry environments.
